message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about building and evaluating multilingual personalized dialogue systems, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper involves training and evaluating models, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of neural networks and evaluation metrics such as perplexity and BLEU score indicate that it could also be classified under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper involves information retrieval techniques such as cross-lingual modeling, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
